result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Russ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during course of probation to probation agent. Any remaining balance due at end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail to apply.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant coulse serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of thse conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of controled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
May not live or work in a place where a firearm is kept.
May not ride in a vehcile where a firearm is present.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
No possession of more than one cell phone or more than one phone number listed under the defendant's name at one time.
No contact with codefendant Vernell T., dob 5/11/82.
No contact with any gang member or associate of any gang.
**Under section 973.049, Court finds and prohibits contact with Vernell T. as he was both coactor and witness in the crime and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Particpate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Report in date is 2/11/15. 
No good time credit. Release for employment and employment interviews. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Russ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Decision and Order Denying Motion for Release on Electronic Monitoring signed 5-18-2015 and filed. tk
Copies mailed to Parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
DEFENDANT'S FOR RELEASE ON ELECTRONIC MONITORING received.
Bail Refund Packet
Bail Notice mailed to surety on 02/24/2015

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Brandon Wigely for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live or work in a place where a firearm is kept.
- Defendant may not ride in a vehicle where a firearm is present.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- No contact with codefendant Vernell T. (DOB 5-11-82).
- No contact with any gang member or associate of any gang. 
- Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction; without good time credit; release for employment and employment interviews. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Vernell T. as he was both coactor and witness in the crime and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Court sets a report in date of 2-11-2015 at 1:15 p.m., Br. 17.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing.
AS TO COUNT 1:  
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 2-10-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Jury Trial scheduled for 1-21-2015, vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial.  Defense requests case be scheduled for an adjourned Final Pretrial for possible negotiations to take place. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial on 1-16-2015 at 1:30 p.m. and Jury Trial on 1-21-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 11-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 1-21-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court denies the Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence. Court orders case adjourned for Status Conference on 9-15-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br.17.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State Officer Zebdee Wilson. Exhibit 1, DVD, offered. Witness cross-examined by the Defense. Sworn forthe State Srgt. Paul Robertson, City of Milwaukee Police Officer. State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense rests. Arguments heard. Court orders case adjourned for Oral Ruling on 9-8-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
  Oral ruling scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Defense provides proof of medical emergency.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State:  Response to Defense Motion to Suppress. alp
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey W Jensen.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Patricia I Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Motion Hearing in Branch 26. Scheduling Order signed, and filed with court.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey W Jensen.  William Levins for Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03/15/14

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs,
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Louis Russ in court with attorney Jeffrey W Jensen.  Daniel J Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/15/14 @ 1:00pm
